messages.content: Are there any tiger reserves in Uttar Pradesh, India?

Yes, as of July 4, 2025, Uttar Pradesh (UP) has four tiger reserves: Dudhwa, Pilibhit, Amangarh, and Ranipur [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGuBclQSXD5cgjOlFjG4yESSZ2XRpe4603DWKAvfISzGXBbMQaDCOP3gU9n5WOadH1la5stSL6UrrAsd-Uta02EAtXWtDjoM19RgeoPifRd0s971pAjQoe-znhjWMMQUES-DJKD3Jg9dpIB_qJvBdppZ20dQPrBRgofM_Y4o94pvaM=).

Here's a summary of each:

*   **Dudhwa Tiger Reserve:** Located in the Lakhimpur Kheri and Bahraich districts, near the Indo-Nepal border [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGuBclQSXD5cgjOlFjG4yESSZ2XRpe4603DWKAvfISzGXBbMQaDCOP3gU9n5WOadH1la5stSL6UrrAsd-Uta02EAtXWtDjoM19RgeoPifRd0s971pAjQoe-znhjWMMQUES-DJKD3Jg9dpIB_qJvBdppZ20dQPrBRgofM_Y4o94pvaM=) [lotusarise](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGa931x9Od4DCdDsQK4CeOP_AeExciExCAK2NDdPWjd0JlfA-TRjTmQhU6ujzwRpejcdWGLsoQVLDqwP0pj4hBT1l8XIOXw06HpZmWh5i8wgtMV85qq5RtQOWr6lUSnosKQjyU_lV0Xv6eb9DMtaKUmui8rE17O). It includes Dudhwa National Park, Kishanpur Wildlife Sanctuary, and Katerniaghat Wildlife Sanctuary [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGuBclQSXD5cgjOlFjG4yESSZ2XRpe4603DWKAvfISzGXBbMQaDCOP3gU9n5WOadH1la5stSL6UrrAsd-Uta02EAtXWtDjoM19RgeoPifRd0s971pAjQoe-znhjWMMQUES-DJKD3Jg9dpIB_qJvBdppZ20dQPrBRgofM_Y4o94pvaM=) [indiatimes](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFWcddjULnDpgfy-NN9Y8cGgN5yA8w_GvuJn2ffvBatotkbrwZsqlGkf7ldimpqMN7hdek8WF4bIhbCyQ_5wuQ1bOY5CR6Vt1kmQ38uCBSGr0XFMdoaanAPWI9HaLbGPlWyIoT8qe5wuEUEjai8Za5UarGhbRfXuWrQZI1tvkdwgVrluULjcsFUHUpHV9ZKLw3woNzeP3eBZLlMgM6sdl2Lxen2OgVioXpakiM0mwhDLdOzi_zq01KmypfHFu7LJUM2Sr7J) [indiatimes](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQEFePsuXGInjl9AJHUFiOm5D9vIQbamp7dfh1_MIzD8_vGW-CXZdB3Gv1ZIZOFKG1plxcxMtR_UEnb1rJf7tocG0l_32FcB2jQ6rVQVbgwzJ3XNgyqJbhFSwYMEzW4TtOxxEavzFAMfSlXKxnWLBtQSHhhMJC0slS9SENLMw7VSajxUJ8J2ouj6O-RfuvJ566-3_RKAYJuN8hk_PcNjamdUq42-EKioDK9QcV7NVpbYebUcz9zEn1KD5dShziRt8uQyESK0ZNcb). It spans approximately 2201.7748 sq. km [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGuBclQSXD5cgjOlFjG4yESSZ2XRpe4603DWKAvfISzGXBbMQaDCOP3gU9n5WOadH1la5stSL6UrrAsd-Uta02EAtXWtDjoM19RgeoPifRd0s971pAjQoe-znhjWMMQUES-DJKD3Jg9dpIB_qJvBdppZ20dQPrBRgofM_Y4o94pvaM=). The tiger abundance within the Dudhwa Tiger Reserve is 135 [khanglobalstudies](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQG-06yPEakNUPFJjsoVOZbhWpyyRTTJze8DzeiwWDIH-H1k3S_z-3fzbKH1-xIt35eQ8NPezdUo4T_eHZYKuJeZtkZN_SrwTfAsex5tUndeoQC3qPSrX3ottZjMYn8F7c1ODAuGXVNTpmYr8AdOSHg4Lv8Bwc7h07nft2aaEJ9qd8Bx2_GyItQ-vULVu9k=). It's the only place in UP where both tigers and rhinos can be spotted together [lotusarise](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGa931x9Od4DCdDsQK4CeOP_AeExciExCAK2NDdPWjd0JlfA-TRjTmQhU6ujzwRpejcdWGLsoQVLDqwP0pj4hBT1l8XIOXw06HpZmWh5i8wgtMV85qq5RtQOWr6lUSnosKQjyU_lV0Xv6eb9DMtaKUmui8rE17O) [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGuBclQSXD5cgjOlFjG4yESSZ2XRpe4603DWKAvfISzGXBbMQaDCOP3gU9n5WOadH1la5stSL6UrrAsd-Uta02EAtXWtDjoM19RgeoPifRd0s971pAjQoe-znhjWMMQUES-DJKD3Jg9dpIB_qJvBdppZ20dQPrBRgofM_Y4o94pvaM=).

*   **Pilibhit Tiger Reserve:** It covers approximately 730 square kilometers [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGuBclQSXD5cgjOlFjG4yESSZ2XRpe4603DWKAvfISzGXBbMQaDCOP3gU9n5WOadH1la5stSL6UrrAsd-Uta02EAtXWtDjoM19RgeoPifRd0s971pAjQoe-znhjWMMQUES-DJKD3Jg9dpIB_qJvBdppZ20dQPrBRgofM_Y4o94pvaM=). In 2020, it received the first TX2 Award for doubling its tiger population between 2014 and 2018, increasing from 25 to 65 tigers [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGuBclQSXD5cgjOlFjG4yESSZ2XRpe4603DWKAvfISzGXBbMQaDCOP3gU9n5WOadH1la5stSL6UrrAsd-Uta02EAtXWtDjoM19RgeoPifRd0s971pAjQoe-znhjWMMQUES-DJKD3Jg9dpIB_qJvBdppZ20dQPrBRgofM_Y4o94pvaM=). Pilibhit Tiger Reserve (PTR) will host training for forest personnel from six tiger reserves and national parks for the National Tiger Conservation Authority's (NTCA) four-yearly national tiger estimation in 2026 [indiatimes](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFWcddjULnDpgfy-NN9Y8cGgN5yA8w_GvuJn2ffvBatotkbrwZsqlGkf7ldimpqMN7hdek8WF4bIhbCyQ_5wuQ1bOY5CR6Vt1kmQ38uCBSGr0XFMdoaanAPWI9HaLbGPlWyIoT8qe5wuEUEjai8Za5UarGhbRfXuWrQZI1tvkdwgVrluULjcsFUHUpHV9ZKLw3woNzeP3eBZLlMgM6sdl2Lxen2OgVioXpakiM0mwhDLdOzi_zq01KmypfHFu7LJUM2Sr7J).

*   **Amangarh Tiger Reserve:** Located in the Bijnor district, serving as a buffer to Jim Corbett National Park [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGuBclQSXD5cgjOlFjG4yESSZ2XRpe4603DWKAvfISzGXBbMQaDCOP3gU9n5WOadH1la5stSL6UrrAsd-Uta02EAtXWtDjoM19RgeoPifRd0s971pAjQoe-znhjWMMQUES-DJKD3Jg9dpIB_qJvBdppZ20dQPrBRgofM_Y4o94pvaM=). It was officially designated as a Tiger Reserve in 2012, covering an area of 95 square kilometers [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGuBclQSXD5cgjOlFjG4yESSZ2XRpe4603DWKAvfISzGXBbMQaDCOP3gU9n5WOadH1la5stSL6UrrAsd-Uta02EAtXWtDjoM19RgeoPifRd0s971pAjQoe-znhjWMMQUES-DJKD3Jg9dpIB_qJvBdppZ20dQPrBRgofM_Y4o94pvaM=).

*   **Ranipur Tiger Reserve:** Situated in the Chitrakoot district, it was declared a tiger reserve in 2022, becoming India's 54th tiger reserve and the first in the Bundelkhand region of Uttar Pradesh [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGuBclQSXD5cgjOlFjG4yESSZ2XRpe4603DWKAvfISzGXBbMQaDCOP3gU9n5WOadH1la5stSL6UrrAsd-Uta02EAtXWtDjoM19RgeoPifRd0s971pAjQoe-znhjWMMQUES-DJKD3Jg9dpIB_qJvBdppZ20dQPrBRgofM_Y4o94pvaM=). It spans 529.89 square kilometers [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQGuBclQSXD5cgjOlFjG4yESSZ2XRpe4603DWKAvfISzGXBbMQaDCOP3gU9n5WOadH1la5stSL6UrrAsd-Uta02EAtXWtDjoM19RgeoPifRd0s971pAjQoe-znhjWMMQUES-DJKD3Jg9dpIB_qJvBdppZ20dQPrBRgofM_Y4o94pvaM=).

web_research_result:
As of July 4, 2025, Uttar Pradesh (UP) has four tiger reserves: Dudhwa, Pilibhit, Amangarh, and Ranipur.

**Tiger Reserves in Uttar Pradesh:**

*   **Dudhwa Tiger Reserve:** Located in the Lakhimpur Kheri and Bahraich districts, near the Indo-Nepal border. [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [lotusarise](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) It includes Dudhwa National Park, Kishanpur Wildlife Sanctuary, and Katerniaghat Wildlife Sanctuary. [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [indiatimes](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2) [indiatimes](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3) In 1987, Dudhwa National Park and Kishanpur Wildlife Sanctuary were declared a tiger reserve under Project Tiger; Katarniaghat Wildlife Sanctuary was added in 2000. [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) It spans approximately 2201.7748 sq. km (core area: 1093.79 sq. km, buffer area: 1107.9848 sq. km) and is traversed by rivers such as Sharda, Suheli, and Mohana. [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) It's the only place in UP where both tigers and rhinos can be spotted together. [lotusarise](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1) [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) The tiger abundance within the Dudhwa Tiger Reserve is 135. [khanglobalstudies](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4)
*   **Pilibhit Tiger Reserve:** In 2020, it received the first TX2 Award for doubling its tiger population between 2014 and 2018, increasing from 25 to 65 tigers. [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) The reserve covers approximately 730 square kilometers (core: 602.7980 sq.km, buffer: 127.4518 sq.km). [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) A boating point has been established in the core zone, and a bamboo hut has been constructed at Chukha beach on the banks of the Sharda River to attract tourists, despite the National Tiger Conservation Authority (NTCA) guidelines against permanent tourism structures in core areas. [tribuneindia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5) [newindianexpress](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6)
*   **Amangarh Tiger Reserve:** Located in the Bijnor district, serving as a buffer to Jim Corbett National Park. [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) It was officially designated as a Tiger Reserve in 2012, covering an area of 95 square kilometers. [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) The Uttar Pradesh government planned to upgrade and rename it as "New Jim Corbett" in 2022. [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) It is situated at the foothills of the Himalayas, with the Ramganga River flowing nearby. [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) Note that some sources consider Amangarh as a buffer zone and not an independent tiger reserve. [guidely](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7) [wiienvis](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-8)
*   **Ranipur Tiger Reserve:** Situated in the Chitrakoot district, it was established as a wildlife sanctuary in 1977 and declared a tiger reserve in 2022, becoming India's 54th tiger reserve and the first in the Bundelkhand region of Uttar Pradesh. [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) It spans 529.89 square kilometers (core area: 230 sq km, buffer zone: 299.58 sq km). [learnupsc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0)

**Conservation Efforts and Initiatives:**

*   **Eco-tourism:** The 2024-25 eco-tourism season for UP's tiger reserves, including Pilibhit, Amangarh, and Dudhwa, launched on November 6, 2024, earlier than usual. [newindianexpress](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6) The state government has invested in tourism facilities, such as boating points and infrastructure upgrades, despite NTCA guidelines against such activities in core tiger zones. [newindianexpress](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6) [tribuneindia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5)
*   **Grassland Management:** A grassland management program, in collaboration with the Indian Grassland and Fodder Research Institute (IGFRI), aims to cultivate perennial grasses in tiger reserves to ensure year-round grazing for herbivores, the primary prey for tigers and leopards. [indiatimes](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3)
*   **Tiger Population:** Uttar Pradesh's tiger population has grown from 173 in 2018 to 205 in 2022. India's tiger population has increased, with an estimated 3,682 tigers in 2022, representing 75% of the world's wild tiger population. [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-9)
*   **River Dolphin Conservation:** Uttar Pradesh has the highest number of dolphins in India, with 2,397 Gangetic Dolphins recorded in March 2025. [knocksense](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-10)
*   **Habitat Improvement:** Massive tree plantation drives are underway along rivers, with a goal to increase the state's green cover to 20% by 2030. [knocksense](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-10)
*   **National Tiger Estimation 2026:** Pilibhit Tiger Reserve (PTR) will host training for forest personnel from six tiger reserves and national parks for the National Tiger Conservation Authority's (NTCA) four-yearly national tiger estimation in 2026. [indiatimes](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2)
